page.title: 09Chorleywood House
page.content: Chorleywood House was built in 1895 by Lady Ella Russell. She built it after her husband's death. The house is off the A404, at the end of a long drive. Lady Ella Russell founded the Working Mens Club and a Rifle Club. Both clubs met at Chorleywood House. Later on she became the President of the Women's Institute which was her main interest till her death in 1936. She employed lots of gardeners to keep the large grounds neat and pretty. She would often invite guests for tea and show off her beautiful gardens. She used to tour the grounds in a small electric carriage. Many festivals and parties were held at the house. On the 12th May 1937 coronation celebrations took place with sports events,fireworks and the King's speech broadcast by loudspeakers. Today the house is the offices of the local council.
